channel.title: BBC News - US & Canada

item.title: Biden calls for gun law reform on anniversary of Parkland shooting
item.description: The US president asks Congress to pass new laws, including a ban on assault weapons.

item.title: Solving Covid easy compared with climate - Bill Gates
item.description: Solving global warming would be “the most amazing thing humanity has done”, says the billionaire.

item.title: Meghan and Prince Harry expecting second child
item.description: The Queen and Royal Family are "delighted", as the Sussexes say "Archie is going to be a big brother".

item.title: Trump impeachment trial: Biden warns democracy is fragile
item.description: Former President Trump is acquitted of a charge of inciting deadly violence in the US Capitol.

item.title: US cold snap: Why is Texas seeing Arctic temperatures?
item.description: Freezing temperatures have been recorded across the usually hot southern US state.

item.title: TJ Ducklo: Biden aide quits over 'abhorrent' language
item.description: TJ Ducklo allegedly threatened to "destroy" a female reporter asking questions about his private life.

item.title: Chris Harrison: Bachelor host to step aside over racism row
item.description: Chris Harrison was accused of minimising controversial photos of a cast member on the hit US show.

item.title: Mr and Mrs Smith reboot to star Phoebe Waller-Bridge and Donald Glover
item.description: The original 2005 film about married assassins starred Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie.

item.title: Why Canada is falling behind in Covid vaccinations
item.description: The country is lagging in its vaccination plans amid a delayed delivery of doses.

item.title: Justin Timberlake apologises to Britney Spears after documentary backlash
item.description: A new documentary shone a light on how Timberlake treated Spears during their relationship.

item.title: Amazon sues NY amid threat of virus labour lawsuit
item.description: The retailer is seeking to block a lawsuit over its response to Covid-19 safety concerns.

item.title: Lulu the dog inherits $5m from deceased US owner
item.description: The will states that the new owner is to be reimbursed for Lulu's reasonable monthly expenses.

item.title: Olympic swimmer Klete Keller faces new charges over Capitol riots
item.description: The gold medallist was allegedly spotted among the crowd in the Rotunda wearing his Team USA jacket.

item.title: Martin Gugino: Charges dropped against US officers who pushed protester
item.description: Charges are dropped against two officers who were filmed knocking down a 75-year-old man last June.

item.title: 'At least you're not a cat!' Congress video goes wrong
item.description: A US congressman made an unusual appearance when struggling with his video conferencing technology.

item.title: Actor Kevin Hart's personal shopper charged with stealing $1m
item.description: Dylan Jason Syer is accused of making unauthorised purchases using the Jumanji actor's credit cards.

item.title: President Biden cancels funding for Trump border wall
item.description: Over $25bn had been spent on the US-Mexico border wall by the time Trump left office last month.

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine: The end of a 'powerful', 'comforting' and 'relatable' show
item.description: Radio 1 Newsbeat speaks to fans of the US comedy after it was announced it was coming to an end.

item.title: Driver captures footage of deadly mass pile-up on a Texas highway
item.description: The early morning pile-up killed at least five people and left others trapped in their vehicles.

item.title: Chick Corea: Tributes paid to jazz 'genius'
item.description: The US keyboardist and composer died on Tuesday, aged 79, from a rare form of cancer.

item.title: US football team celebrates Super Bowl win with boat parade
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers beat the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday in the biggest game in US sport.

item.title: Mandalorian star dropped after 'abhorrent' posts
item.description: Lucasfilm says the actor's comments are 'abhorrent' and has no plans to work with her again.

item.title: Why the US is eyeing a $300 monthly child benefit
item.description: Child poverty in the US "is an emergency and not a temporary one" advocates say.

item.title: Nasa's pioneering black women
item.description: The mathematicians who worked behind the scenes on the American space programme.

item.title: How Mike Pence became a villain in Trump world
item.description: A pro-Trump mob called the loyal former vice-president a traitor who should be hanged. What changed?

item.title: Capitol riots timeline: The evidence presented against Trump
item.description: Democrats show chilling and violent footage of the riot - some new - during the impeachment trial.

item.title: China Mac: From attempted murder to leading a protest movement
item.description: China Mac served 11 years in jail for attempted murder. Now he is leading an anti-racism movement.

item.title: Will Framing Britney Spears be a moment of reckoning for the celebrity media?
item.description: A new documentary has sparked a wave of support for the star. Can it change celebrity culture?

item.title: Elisa Lam: What really happened in the Cecil Hotel
item.description: The 21-year-old went missing in 2013, and internet folklore has haunted her memory ever since.

item.title: GameStop investors on a wild ride: 'It was a rollercoaster of emotion'
item.description: Now that the dust has settled, who are the winners and losers in the GameStop saga?

item.title: A behind-the-scenes peek into President Trump's diplomacy
item.description: A new BBC series explores former President Donald Trump's foreign policy through firsthand accounts.

item.title: Amazon fight with workers: 'You're a cog in the system'
item.description: Activists are trying to unionise Amazon workers in Bessemer, Alabama, which would be a first for the US - if they succeed.

item.title: Capitol riots: Five takeaways from the arrests
item.description: Those who have been charged so far come from a variety of backgrounds and at least 41 states.

item.title: Trump impeachment: The terror of being trapped in the US Capitol
item.description: Three members of Congress describe in vivid detail what they saw as rioters stormed the building.

item.title: Super Bowl half-time show: How did The Weeknd do?
item.description: The pop star, joined by two dozen bandaged dancers, transformed the stadium into a neon cityscape.

item.title: Trump impeachment explained
item.description: Donald Trump’s second impeachment trial opens on Tuesday - but what's it all about?

item.title: Joe Neguse delivers prosecution's closing argument at Trump trial
item.description: Democrat Joe Neguse presents the prosecution's closing argument at Donald Trump's impeachment trial.

item.title: New video of police under attack at Capitol shown at Trump trial
item.description: "We've lost the line...pull back" - the Trump impeachment trial is shown new footage from the Capitol riot.

item.title: Trump impeachment: What the Proud Boys did before president's speech
item.description: A detailed examination of video reveals how far right extremists and militia stormed the US Capitol.

item.title: Raskin: 'They thought they were going to die'
item.description: Democrat Jamie Raskin shares an emotional story about his daughter's experience during the riot.

item.title: Trump lawyer: 'Overriding emotion is to cry for the US Constitution'
item.description: A lawyer for Trump said the impeachment trial represented a "great danger" to the presidency.

item.title: So what is Jeff Bezos going to do now?
item.description: After stepping down as CEO of Amazon, Bezos says he will focus on his 'other passions'.

item.title: 'I got my Florida school district to convert to electric buses'
item.description: Holly Thorpe's science fair project measured CO2 levels around school buses and led to the change.

item.title: Have US police departments become too militarised?
item.description: President Biden is reportedly looking to restrict local police from receiving surplus military gear.

item.title: Smithsonian Zoo pandas play in Washington DC snow
item.description: Panda pair Mei Xiang and Tian Tian rolled around in the snow in their temporary home.

item.title: Stocks explained: What's going on with GameStop?
item.description: Chris Fox explains stocks, short-selling and what has been happening with GameStop shares.

item.title: The story behind the inauguration's sign language Pledge of Allegiance
item.description: Fire Captain Andrea Hall stole the show - and there is a personal story behind her unique pledge.

item.title: Biden: 'Time to act' on climate crisis
item.description: President Joe Biden signs executive orders on climate change, saying the US has waited too long.

item.title: Biden: 'Systemic racism is corrosive, destructive and costly'
item.description: The president said eliminating racism wouldn't happen overnight, but the US was "less prosperous" because of it.

item.title: Meet the woman behind Bernie Sanders' famous mittens
item.description: Jen Ellis made the mittens Bernie Sanders wore at President Biden's inauguration - now she's receiving thousands of orders.

item.title: Canada 'Sixties Scoop': Indigenous survivors map out their stories
item.description: Canada's "Sixties Scoop" saw thousands of indigenous children forcibly removed from their families.

item.title: New Christmas campaign for Canadians held in China
item.description: The campaign is based on efforts around a similar case involving a British journalist fifty years ago.

item.title: New Brunswick outbreak: How a smalltown doctor became a Covid pariah
item.description: After being labelled "patient zero", a small-town physician in Canada was shunned.
